content: Create a JavaScript function that checks if all elements in an array are unique. PLAINFORMAT

Sure, here's a JavaScript function that checks if all elements in an array are unique:

```javascript
function areElementsUnique(arr) {
    const uniqueElements = new Set(arr);
    return uniqueElements.size === arr.length;
}
```

You can use this function by passing an array as an argument. It will return `true` if all elements are unique and `false` otherwise.

Example usage:

```javascript
console.log(areElementsUnique([1, 2, 3, 4])); // true
console.log(areElementsUnique([1, 2, 2, 4])); // false
```

This function works by creating a `Set` from the array, which automatically removes any duplicate elements. Then, it compares the size of the `Set` to the length of the original array. If they are equal, all elements were unique; otherwise, there were duplicates.
